paragraphs.text: CIA interrogation report: Democrats want to punish America, blame Bush.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: In its ideological zeal to punish America
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the outgoing Democratically- controlled Senate, plans to make public a report that, according to Fox News will examine "the alleged use of torture by the CIA."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Although the 6,000 page full report will remain classified
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the 500 page summary is expected to be released to the public in coming days
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: According to press reports from those who are familiar with the study, it is expected to portray the American intelligence community in the worst possible light
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The report's release and details about CIA interrogations that took place a decade ago will endanger Americans abroad today, destroy essential relationships with foreign intelligence communities going forward, and cripple American human intelligence gathering networks for a generation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Put bluntly
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Democrats in the Senate are behaving like tenants who got evicted and decide to trash the house on their way out the door
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is nothing to be gained by releasing the report
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The CIA's actions in the immediate aftermath of September 11 attacks have long since ceased
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Although President Obama has approved release of the report's summary
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: even Secretary of State John Kerry has warned that the report's release will put Americans and U.S  embassies at risk of retaliation
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: So why do this now?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Perhaps Democrats in Congress think that by excoriating our intelligence community before the entire world they will expiate the sins of the previous administration
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yes, it's another chance it's to blame Bush!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is the apology tour on steroids
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: According to media reports, the report concludes that we tortured terrorists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These are the same terrorists who blew up the World Trade Center, bombed the Pentagon, and tried to level the U.S  Capitol
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These are the same terrorists that today have beheaded Christians, Westerners and, just this past weekend, another American citizen
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Think back to the days after September 11
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: We were blind about Al Qaeda
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Most Americans feared another attack was imminent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the best legal advice in government said CIA actions to get that information were legal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So CIA officers did what they thought necessary to protect Americans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A decade later we're suddenly castigating them for it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Second
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the report concludes that the intelligence gathered from CIA's actions wasn't effective
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet that has been disputed by the very people in the Obama administration who used it to track down Usama bin Laden
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To quote highly regarded former CIA Director Gen  Michael Hayden,"it is inconceivable to believe that three different CIA directors, and three different Deputy CIA directors, conspired over a seven year period to lie about the program's effectiveness
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Third
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there is a rule in foreign policy like the one in medicine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: do no harm
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Public release of this report will do immeasurable harm
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will encourage terrorists around the world to launch revenge attacks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will cause foreign intelligence agencies to clam up and no longer cooperate with US intelligence for fear that their sources and method will be blown
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will cause every American intelligence officer to go into the defensive crouch
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: don't stick your head out to protect America because years later somebody in government who wants to score political points will chop it off
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Finally
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: take a lesson from history
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We did this once before, in the 1970's
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when presidential-hopeful Senator Frank Church launched a widespread investigation of the CIA
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It didn't work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Senator Church's presidential aspirations never got off the ground
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But his handiwork crippled American intelligence gathering for a generation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: American agents overseas were killed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: foreign intelligence agencies stopped sharing intelligence with us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: our own human networks collapsed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: CIA officers played it safe and stopped thinking outside the box
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This was one of the reasons a generation later we never knew about a bunch of Islamic extremists in a cave in Afghanistan plotting to take down the Twin Towers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Releasing the report to the public will do considerable harm to our efforts to gather essential intelligence about those hoping to do us harm
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will be a self-inflicted wound
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The next time we are caught unprepared it won' t just be with 747s flying into buildings
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it could be with weapons too terrible to contemplate
paragraphs.label: assumption
